lines.gurmukhi: 1 guxwN AvguxwN dI gqI
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: swier ivchu inklY kwlkUtu qY AMmiRq vwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Saair Vichahu Nikalai Kaalakootu Tai Anmrit Vaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Deadly poison and nectar both were churned out of the ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: auq KwDY mir mukIAY auq KwDY huie Amru prwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Out Khaadhai Mari Moukeeai Outu Khaadhai Hoi Amaru Paraanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Taking poison, one, dies whereas taking the other, (nectar) man becomes immortal.

lines.gurmukhi: ivsu vsY muih sp dY grV dugwir AimA rs jwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Visu Vasai Muhi Sap Dai Gararh Dougaari Amia Ras Jaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Poison resides in the mouth of snake and the jewel eructed by the blue jay (the eater of snakes) is known to be life-giving nectar.

lines.gurmukhi: kwau n BwvY boilAw koiel bolI sBnwN BwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Kaau N Bhaavai Boliaa Koil Bolee Sabhanaan Bhaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Crowing of the crow is disliked but the sound of nightingale is loved by all.

lines.gurmukhi: burbolw n suKwveI imT bolw jig imqu ivfwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Burabolaa N Soukhaavaee Mitd Bolaa Jagi Mitu Vidaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Evil speaker is not liked but the sweet tongued is praised all over the world.

lines.gurmukhi: burw Blw sYswr ivic praupkwr ivkwr inswxI
lines.transliteration_english: Buraa Bhalaa Saisaar Vichi Paraoupakaar Vikaar Nisaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Evil and good persons live in the same world but they are distinguished by their qualities of benevolent and perverted actions.

lines.gurmukhi: gux Avgux giq AwiK vKwxI ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Goun Avagoun Gati Aakhi Vakhaanee ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: We have here exposed the position of merits and demerits.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 KojI Aqy vwdI

Shabad OS B.translation: Researcher and the disputant

lines.gurmukhi: suJhu suJin iqin loA AMnHy GuGU suJu n suJY
lines.transliteration_english: Sujhahu Sujhani Tini Loa Annhay Ghoughoo Sujhu N Sujhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: With sun's light all the three worlds are visible but the blind and the owl can not see the sun.

lines.gurmukhi: ckvI sUrj hyqu hY kMqu imlY ivrqMqu su buJY
lines.transliteration_english: Chakavee Sooraj Haytu Hai Kantu Milai Viratantu Su Bujhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The female ruddy sheldrake loves the sun, and meeting the beloved they tell and listen to the love story of each other.

lines.gurmukhi: rwiq AnHyrw pMKIAwN ckvI icqu AnHyir n ruJY
lines.transliteration_english: Raati Anhayraa Pankheeaan Chakavee Chitu Anhayri N Rujhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: For all other birds the night is dark (and they sleep) but ruddy sheldrake's mind has no rest in that darkness (its mind is ever attued to sun).

lines.gurmukhi: ibMb AMdir pRiqibMbu dyiK Brqw jwix sujwix smuJY
lines.transliteration_english: Binb Andari Pratibinbu Daykhi Bharataa Jaani Sujaani Samujhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: An intellegent woman recognises her husband even by seeing his shadow in water,

lines.gurmukhi: dyiK pCwvw pvy KUih fuib mrY sIhu loien luJY
lines.transliteration_english: Daykhi Pachhaavaa Pavay Khoohi Doubi Marai Seehu Loin Lujhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: But the foolish lion, seeing its own shadow in the well jumps in it and dies and then blames its own eyes.

lines.gurmukhi: KojI KojY Koju lY vwdI vwdu kryNdV KuJY
lines.transliteration_english: Khojee Khojai Khoju Lai Vaadee Vaadu Karayndarh Khujhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The researcher discovers the import of the above description but the disputant is led astray

lines.gurmukhi: gors gweIN hsiqn duJY ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Gorasu Gaaeen Hasatini Dujhai ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: And expects to get cow-milk from a female elephant (which in fact is impossible).

lines.gurmukhi: 3 bgl smwDI

Shabad OS B.translation: Wicked persons remain unhappy even in happiness

lines.gurmukhi: swvx vx hrIAwvly vuTy sukY Aku jvwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Saavan Van Hareeaavalay Voutday Soukai Aku Javaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the month of Sayan forests go green but akk, a wild plant of sandy region, and /avail, the camel thorn, wither.

lines.gurmukhi: cyiq vxspiq maulIAY Apq krIr n krY auswhw
lines.transliteration_english: Chayti Vanasapati Mauleeai Apat Kareer N Karai Ousaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the month of Chaitr, the vegetation blooms but leafless kart (a wild caper) remains totally uninspired.

lines.gurmukhi: suPl PlMdy ibrK sB isMmlu APlu rhY Aivswhw
lines.transliteration_english: Suphal Phaladay Birakh Sabh Sinmalu Aphalu Rahai Avisaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: All the trees become full of fruits but the silk cotton tree remains devoid of fruit.

lines.gurmukhi: cMnx vwsu vxwspiq vwNs invwis n auBy swhw
lines.transliteration_english: Channan Vaasu Vanaasapati Vaans Nivaasi N Oubhay Saahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The whole vegetation is made fragrant by sandal wood but bamboo gets no impact of it and goes on sobbing and sighing.

lines.gurmukhi: sMKu smuMdhu sKxw duiKAwrw rovY dy DwhwN
lines.transliteration_english: Sankhu Samoundahu Sakhanaa Doukhiaaraa Rovai Day Dhaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even being in the ocean, the conch remains empty and cries bitterly when blown.

lines.gurmukhi: bgul smwDI gMg ivic JIgY cuix cuix Kwie iBCwhw
lines.transliteration_english: Bagul Samaadhee Gang Vichi Jheegai Chouni Chouni Khaai Bhichhaahaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The crane even looking to be meditating upon the banks of Ganges, like a beggar picks up the fish and eats them up.

lines.gurmukhi: swQ ivCuMny imldw Pwhw ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Saad Vichhounnay Miladaa Dhaahaa ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: Separation from good company brings noose for the individual.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 Blw burw

Shabad OS B.translation: Good and bad

lines.gurmukhi: Awip Blw sBu jgu Blw Blw Blw sBnw kir dyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapi Bhalaa Sabhu Jagu Bhalaa Bhalaa Bhalaa Sabhanaa Kari Daykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: One's good mind finds everybody good in the world. A gentleman beholds everyone as gentle.

lines.gurmukhi: Awip burw sBu jgu burw sB ko burw bury dy lyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapi Buraa Sabhu Jagu Buraa Sabh Ko Buraa Buray Day Laykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If one is bad himself, for him the whole world is bad and all is bad on his account. Lord Krsna helped

lines.gurmukhi: iksnu shweI pwNfvwN Bwie Bgiq krqUiq ivsyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Kisanu Sahaaee Paandavaa Bhaai Bhagati Karatooti Visaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Pindays because they had in them profuse sense of devotion and morality.

lines.gurmukhi: vYr Bwau iciq kYrvwN gxqI gxin AMdir kwlyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Vair Bhaau Chiti Kairavaan Ganatee Ganani Andari Kaalaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Kaurays had enmity in their heart and they always calculated the dark side of things.

lines.gurmukhi: Blw burw prvMinAw Bwlx gey n idsit sryKY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhalaa Buraa Paravanniaa Bhaalan Gaay N Disati Saraykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Two princes went out to find a good and a wicked person but their views were different.

lines.gurmukhi: burw nw koeI juiDstrY durjoDn ko Blw n ByKY
lines.transliteration_english: Buraa N Koee Judhisatarai Durajodhan Ko Bhalaa N Bhaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: None was bad for Yudhisthar and Duryodhan did not find any good person.

lines.gurmukhi: krvY hoie su totI ryKY ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Karavai Hoi Su Totee Raykhai ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Whatever (sweet or bitter) is there in the pot is known when it comes out through the spout.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 Drmrwj dI pRisD kQw

Shabad OS B.translation: Famous tale of Dharmaraj

lines.gurmukhi: sUrju Gir Avqwru lY Drm vIcwrix jwie bihTw
lines.transliteration_english: Sooraju Ghari Avataaru Lai Dharam Veechaarani Jaai Bahitdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Born in the family of Sun, he (Dharrnaraj) adorned the seat of the dispenser of justice.

lines.gurmukhi: mUriq iekw nwau duie Drmrwie jm dyiK sirTw
lines.transliteration_english: Moorati Ikaa Naau Dui Dharam Raai Jam Daykhi Saritdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is one but the creation knows him by two names-Dharmaraj and Yama.

lines.gurmukhi: DrmI ifTw Drmrwie pwpu kmwie pwpI jm ifTw
lines.transliteration_english: Dharamee Ditdaa Dharam Raai Paapu Kamaai Paapee Jam Ditdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: People see him pious and righteous in the form of Dharmaraj but the wicked sinner as Yama.

lines.gurmukhi: pwpI no pCVwieMdw DrmI nwil bulyNdw imTw
lines.transliteration_english: Paapee No Pachharhaaindaa Dharamee Naali Bulayndaa Mitdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He also thrashes the evil doer but speks sweetly to the religious person.

lines.gurmukhi: vYrI dyKin vYr Bwie imqR Bwie kir dyKin ieTw
lines.transliteration_english: Vairee Daykhani Vair Bhaai Mitr Bhaai Kari Daykhani Itdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Enemy sees him with enmity and the friendly people know him as loving one.

lines.gurmukhi: nrk surg ivic puMn pwp vr srwp jwxin ABirTw
lines.transliteration_english: Narak Surag Vichi Pounn Paap Var Saraap Jaanani Abharitdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sin and merit, boon and curse, heaven and hell are known and realised according to one's own feelings (of love and enmity).

lines.gurmukhi: drpix rUp ijvyhI ipTw ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Darapani Roop Jivayhee Pitdaa ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: Mirror reflects the shadow according to the object before it.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 su`D AwrsI

Shabad OS B.translation: Clean mirror

lines.gurmukhi: ijauN kir inrml AwrsI sBw suD sB koeI dyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Jioun Kari Niramal Aarasee Sabhaa Sudh Sabh Koee Daykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the clean mirror everybody sees his correct shape.

lines.gurmukhi: gorw gory idsdw kwlw kwly vMnu ivsyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Goraa Goray Disadaa Kaalaa Kaalo Vannu Visaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fair complexion is reflected fair and black one specifically black in it.

lines.gurmukhi: his his dyKY hsq muK roNdw rovxhwru sulyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Hasi Hasi Daykhai Hasat Moukh Rondaa Rovanahaaru Sulaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A laughing person finds his face laughing and weeping one as weeping in it.

lines.gurmukhi: lypu n lgY AwrsI iCA drsnu idsin bhu ByKY
lines.transliteration_english: Laypu N Lagai Aarasee Chhia Darasanu Disani Bahu Bhaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The followers of six philosophies wearing different guises see in it, but the mirror remains detached to them all.

lines.gurmukhi: durmiq dUjw Bwau hY vYru ivroDu kroD kulyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Duramati Doojaa Bhaau Hai Vairu Virodhu Karodhu Kulaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sense of duality is the evil intellect which is the another name of enmity, opposition and anger.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq inrmlu inrmlw smdrsI smdrs sryKY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Niramalu Niramalaa Samadarasee Samadaras Saraykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Pious followers of the wisdom of Guru always remain pure and egalitarian.

lines.gurmukhi: Blw burw huie rUp n ryKY ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhalaa Buraa Hui Roopu N Raykhai ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Otherwise, there is no other distinction of the good and the bad person.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 gurU pwhrU

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru, the caretaker guard

lines.gurmukhi: iekqu sUrij AwQvY rwiq AnyrI cmkin qwry
lines.transliteration_english: Ikatu Sooraji Aadavai Raati Anayree Chamakani Taaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Once the son sets in the evening stars twinkle in the dark night.

lines.gurmukhi: swh svin Gir AwpxY cor iPrix Gir musxYhwry
lines.transliteration_english: Saah Savani Ghari Aapanai Chor Dhirani Ghari Muhanaihaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rich people sleep in their homes but the thieves move around to commit thefts.

lines.gurmukhi: jwgin ivrly pwhrU rUAwiein husIAwr ibdwry
lines.transliteration_english: Jaagani Viralay Paaharoo Rooaaini Houseeaar Bidaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: A few guards remain awake and go on shouting to alert others.

lines.gurmukhi: jwig jgwiein suiqAw swh PVMdy cor cgwry
lines.transliteration_english: Jaagi Jagaaini Soutiaan Saah Dharhanday Chor Chagaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those awakened watchmen make sleeping people awake and this way they catch hold of thiefs and vagabonds.

lines.gurmukhi: jwgidAw Gru riKAw suqy Gr musin vycwry
lines.transliteration_english: Jaagadiaan Gharu Rakhiaa Soutay Ghar Mousani Vaychaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who remain awake protect their homes but the house is looted of those who go on sleeping.

lines.gurmukhi: swh Awey Gir AwpxY cor jwir lY grdin mwrY
lines.transliteration_english: Saah Aaay Ghari Aapanai Chor Jaari Lai Garadani Maaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The rich men handing over the thieves (to the authorities), happily return home but caught from their necks the thieves are beaten hollow.

lines.gurmukhi: Bly bury vrqin sYswry ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhalay Buray Varatani Saisaaray ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: The evil and the meritorious both are active in this world.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 sMg suBwau

Shabad OS B.translation: Nature of the company

lines.gurmukhi: mauly AMb bsMq ruiq AauVI Aku su PulI BirAw
lines.transliteration_english: Maulay Anb Basant Routi Aurhee Aku Su Phulee Bhariaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In spring season, the mangoes blossom and akk the bitter wild plant of sandy region also becomes full of flowers.

lines.gurmukhi: AMib n lgY KKVI Aik n lgY AMbu APirAw
lines.transliteration_english: Anbi N Lagai Khakharhee Aki N Lagai Anbu Adhariaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The pod of akk cannot produce mango and fruitless akk cannot grow on mango tree.

lines.gurmukhi: kwlI koiel AMb vix Aikiqfu icqu imqwlw hirAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaalee Koil Anb Vani Akitidu Chitu Mitaalaa Hariaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nightingale sitting on mango tree is black and the grosshopper of akk is speckled one or green.

lines.gurmukhi: mn pMKyrU ibrK Bydu sMg suBwau soeI Plu DirAw
lines.transliteration_english: Man Pankhayroo Birad Bhaydu Sang Soubhaau Soee Phalu Dhariaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mind is a bird and due to difference of the results of different company, it gets the fruit of the tree it chooses to sit upon.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq frdw swDsMig durmiq sMig AswD n firAw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Daradaa Saadhasangi Duramati Sangi Asaadh N Dariaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mind is scared of holy congregation and the wisdom of the Guru but is not afraid of evil company and evil intellect i.e. it does not want to go in good company and takes interest in the evil company.

lines.gurmukhi: Bgiq vClu BI AwKIAY piqq auDwrix piqq auDirAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagati Vachhalu Bhee Aakheeai Patit Udhaarani Patit Udhariaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: God is said to be loving towards saints and liberator of the fallen ones.

lines.gurmukhi: jo iqsu Bwxw soeI qirAw ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Jo Tisu Bhaanaa Soee Tariaa ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: He has salvaged many fallen pepole and only he gets across who is accepted by Him.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 pUqnw

Shabad OS B.translation: Mani

lines.gurmukhi: jykir auDrI pUqnw ivhu pIAwlxu kMmu n cMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Kari Udharee Pootanaa Vihu Peeaalanu Kanmu N Changaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: If even Pfitana (female demon) got liberated that does not mean that poisoning some one is a good act.

lines.gurmukhi: ginkw auDrI AwKIAY pr Gir jwie n leIAY pMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Ganikaa Udharee Aakheeai Par Ghari Jaai N Laeeai Pangaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gariika (a prostitute) was liberated but one should not enter other's house and invite trouble.

lines.gurmukhi: bwlmIku insqwirAw mwrY vwt n hoie insMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Baalameeku Nisataariaa Maarai Vaat N Hoi Nisangaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Since Valmlici got blest, one should not adopt the way of highway robbery.

lines.gurmukhi: PMiDk auDrY AwKIAin PwhI pwie n PVIAY tMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhandhaki Udharai Aakheeani Dhaahee Paai N Dharheeai Tangaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: One bird catcher is also said to be liberated, but we should not catch hold of the leg of others by using snares.

lines.gurmukhi: jy kwsweI auDirAw jIAw Gwie n KweIAY BMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Kaasaaee Udhariaa Jeeaa Ghaai N Khaaeeai Bhangaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: If Sadhana, the butcher got across (the world ocean), we should not put ourselves to harm by killing others.

lines.gurmukhi: pwir auqwrY boihQw suienw lohu nwhI iek rMgw
lines.transliteration_english: Paari Outaarai Bohidaa Suinaa Lohu Naahee Ik Rangaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ship takes across both iron and gold but still their forms and colours are not the same.

lines.gurmukhi: iequ BrvwsY rhxu kuFMgw ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Itu Bharavaasai Rahanu Kuddhangaa ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: In fact, living on such hopes is a bad life style.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 pwp dI rIs burI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: It is always bad to imitate evil

lines.gurmukhi: pY KwjUrI jIvIAY cViH KwjUrI JVau n koeI
lines.transliteration_english: Pai Khaajooree Jeeveeai Charhhi Khaajooree Jharhau N Koee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Surviving the fall from the palm tree does not mean that one should climb the tree to fall from it.

lines.gurmukhi: auJiV pieAw n mwrIAY auJV rwhu n cMgw hoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Ujharhi Paiaa N Maareeai Ujharh Raahu N Changaa Hoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even if one is not killed in desolete places and ways, moving on deserted places is not safe.

lines.gurmukhi: jy sp KwDw aubry spu n PVIAY AMiq ivgoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Jay Sap Khaadhaa Oubaray Sapu N Dharheeai Anti Vigoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: One may survive even when bitten by a sanke even then catching the sanke will be harmful ultimately.

lines.gurmukhi: vhix vhMdw inklY ivxu qulhy fuib mrY BloeI
lines.transliteration_english: Vahani Vahandaa Nikalai Vinu Tulahay Doubi Marai Bhaloee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting washed away by the current of river if someone comes out of it alone, even then in entering the river without a raft there is more possibility of drowning.

lines.gurmukhi: piqq auDwrxu AwKIAY ivrqIhwxu jwxu jwxoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Patit Udhaaranu Aakheeai Virateehaanu Jaanu Jaanoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: People of all inclinations know very well that God is liberator of the fallen ones.

lines.gurmukhi: BwauBgiq gurmiq hY durmiq drgh lhY n FoeI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaau Bhagati Guramati Hai Duramati Daragah Lahai N Ddhoee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Precept of the Guru (Gurmat) is the loving devotion and the people having evil intellect do not get shelter in the court of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: AMiq kmwxw hoie sQoeI ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Anti Kamaanaa Hoi Sadoee ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: The deeds done in life are the only companions in the end.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 gurmuK mnmuK dw Prk guxw krky

Shabad OS B.translation: Different qualities of Gurmukh and Manmukh

lines.gurmukhi: Qom kQUrI vwsu ijau kMcnu lohu nhIN iek vMnw
lines.transliteration_english: Dom Kadooree Vaasu Jioun Kanchanu Lohu Naheen Ik Vannaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the smell of the garlic and musk is different, the gold and iron are also not the same.

lines.gurmukhi: Ptk n hIry quil hY smsir nVI n vVIAY gMnw
lines.transliteration_english: Dhatak N Heeray Tuli Hai Samasari Narhee N Varheeai Gannaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Glass crystal is not equal to diamond and likewise, the sugarcane and a hollow reed are not the same.

lines.gurmukhi: quil n rqnw rqkw muil n kcu ivkwvY pMnw
lines.transliteration_english: Tuli N Ratanaa Ratakaan Muli N Kachu Vikaavai Pannaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Red and black seed (rata) is not equal to jewel and glass cannot sell at the price of emerald.

lines.gurmukhi: durmiq GuMmx vwxIAY gurmiq sukiRqu boihQu bMnwN
lines.transliteration_english: Duramati Ghounman Vaaneeai Guramati Soukritu Bohidu Bannaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Evil intellect is a whirlpool but the wisdom of Guru (gurmat) is the ship of good deeds that takes across.

lines.gurmukhi: inMdw hovy bury dI jY jY kwr Bly DMnu DMnw
lines.transliteration_english: Nidaa Hovai Buray Dee Jai Jai Kaar Bhalay Dhannu Dhannaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Evil person is always condemned and the good person is applauded by all.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK prgtu jwxIAY mnmuK scu rhY prCMnw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Paragatu Jaaneeai Manamoukh Sachu Rahai Parachhannaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Through the gurmukhs, the truth becomes manifest and thus is known by one and all, but in the manmukhs, the same truth is pressed and concealed.

lines.gurmukhi: kMim n AwvY BwNfw BMnw ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Kanmi N Aavai Bhaandaa Bhannaa ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: Like a broken pot, it is of no use.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 auho hI, krnI krky

Shabad OS B.translation: Fame and disrepute according to the actions ,

lines.gurmukhi: iek vycin hQIAwr GiV iek svwrin islw sMjoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Vaychani Hadeeaar Gharhi Ik Savaarani Silaa Sanjoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Many a man prepare arms and sell them out and many cleanse armours.

lines.gurmukhi: rx ivic Gwau bcwau kir duie dl iniq auiT krdy FoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Ran Vichi Ghaau Bachaau Kari Dui Dal Niti Outdi Karaday Ddhoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the batle the arms inflict wounds and armours protect as the warriors of both the armies clash time and again.

lines.gurmukhi: Gwielu hoie nMgwsxw bKqr vwlw nvwN inroAw
lines.transliteration_english: Ghaailu Hoi Nagaasanaa Bakhatar Vaalaa Navaan Niroaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those uncovered are wounded but those who have worn the armour remain well and intact.

lines.gurmukhi: krin gumwnu kmwngr KwnjrwdI bhuqu bKoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Karani Goumaanu Kamaanagar Khaanajaraadee Bahoutu Bakhoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bow makers also feel proud of their special bows.

lines.gurmukhi: jg ivic swD AswD sMgu sMg suBwie jwie Plu BoAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jag Vichi Saadh Asaadh Sangu Sang Soubhaai Jaai Phalu Bhoaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Two types of associations, one of the sadhus and the other of the wicked ones are there in this world and meeting them different results are produced.

lines.gurmukhi: krm su Drm ADrm kir suK duK AMdir Awie proAw
lines.transliteration_english: Karam Su Dharam Adharam Kari Soukh Doukh Andari Aai Paroaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: That is why, the individual because of his good and bad conduct remains absorbed in his pleasures or sufferings.

lines.gurmukhi: Bly bury jsu Apjsu hoAw ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhalay Buray Jasu Apajasu Hoaa ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: The good and bad receive fame and infamy respectively.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 auho hI

Shabad OS B.translation: Fame and disrepute according to the actions

lines.gurmukhi: squ sMqoKu dieAw Drmu ArQ sugrQu swDsMig AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sat Santokhu Daiaa Dharamu Arad Sougaradu Saadhasangi Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Truth, contentment, compassion, dharma, wealth, and other best things are attained in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: kwmu kroDu AswD sMig loBu mohu AhMkwr mcwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaamu Karodhu Asaadh Sangi Lobhi Mohu Ahankaar Machaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Association with the wicked increases lust, anger, greed, infatuation and ego.

lines.gurmukhi: dukiRqu sukiRqu krm kir burw Blw huie nwau DrwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Doukritu Soukritu Karam Kari Buraa Bhalaa Hui Naaoun Dharaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A good or a bad name is earned on account of good or bad deeds respectively.

lines.gurmukhi: gorsu gweI Kwie KVu ieku ieku jxdI vgu vDwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Gorasu Gaaeen Khaai Kharhu Iku Iku Janadee Vagu Vadhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Eating grass and oilcakes, the cow gives milk and giving birth to calves increases the herd.

lines.gurmukhi: duiD pIqY ivhu dyie sp jix jix bhly bcy KwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Dudhi Peetai Vihu Dayi Sap Jani Jani Bahalay Bachay Khaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Drinking milk, the snake vomits poison and eats up its Own progeny.

lines.gurmukhi: sMg suBwau AswDu swDu pwpu puMnu duKu suKu Plu pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Sang Soubhaau Asaadh Saadhu Paapu Pounnu Doukhu Soukhu Phalu Paavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The association with the sadhus and wickeds variously produces sin and meirit, sorrows and pleasures.

lines.gurmukhi: praupkwr ivkwru kmwvY ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Paraoupakaar Vikaaru Kamaavai ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: The fill, inculcates benevolence or evil propensities.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 Blw burw

Shabad OS B.translation: Good and bad one

lines.gurmukhi: cMnxu ibrKu subwsu dy cMnxu krdw ibrK sbwey
lines.transliteration_english: Channanu Birakhu Soubaasu Day Channanu Karadaa Birakh Sabaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Giving fragrance to all trees, the sandalwood tree makes them fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: Khdy vwNshuN Aig DuiK Awip jlY prvwru jlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Khahaday Vaansahu Agi Dhoukhi Aapi Jalai Paravaaru Jalaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: By the friction of the bamboos (on the other hand) the bamboo itself gets burnt and burns the whole family (of bamboos).

lines.gurmukhi: mulh ijvY pMKyrUAw PwsY Awip kutMb Phwey
lines.transliteration_english: Mulah Jivai Pankhayrooaa Dhaasai Aapi Koutanb Dhahaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Twithering quail not only gets caught but also makes the whole family ensnared.

lines.gurmukhi: Ast Dwqu huie prbqhu pwrsu kir kMcnu idKlwey
lines.transliteration_english: Asat Dhaatu Hui Parabatahu Paarasu Kari Kanchanu Dikhalaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The eight metals found in the mountains are converted into gold by the philosopher's stone.

lines.gurmukhi: gixkw vwVY jwie kY hovin rogI pwp kmwey
lines.transliteration_english: Ganikaa Vaarhai Jaai Kai Hovani Rogee Paap Kamaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The people going to the prostitutes earn sins besides contagious diseases.

lines.gurmukhi: duKIey Awvin vYd Gr dwrU dy dy rogu imtwey
lines.transliteration_english: Doukheeay Aavani Vaid Ghar Daaroo Day Day Rogu Mitaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sufferers from a disease come to the physician and he giving medicine cures them.

lines.gurmukhi: Blw burw duie sMg suBwey ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhalaa Buraa Dui Sang Soubhaaay ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: Because of the nature of the company kept, one becomes good or bad.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 Blw burw

Shabad OS B.translation: Good and bad

lines.gurmukhi: Blw suBwau mjIT dw shY Avtxu rMgu cVHwey
lines.transliteration_english: Bhalaa Soubhaau Majeetd Daa Sahai Avatanu Rangu Charhhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The nature of madder is gentle; it bears the heat but dyes others in fast colour.

lines.gurmukhi: gMnw kolU pIVIAY ttir pieAw imTwsu vDwey
lines.transliteration_english: Gannaa Koloo Peerheeai Tatari Paiaa Mitdaasu Vadhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sugarcane is first crushed in crusher and then put on fire in a cauldron where it further increases its sweetness when baking soda is put into it.

lines.gurmukhi: quMmy AMmiRqu isMjIAY kauVqx dI bwix n jwey
lines.transliteration_english: Tounmay Anmritu Sinjeeai Kaurhatan Dee Baani N Jaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Colocynth even if irrigated with nectar, does not shed its bitterness.

lines.gurmukhi: Avgux kIqy gux krY Blw n Avgux iciq vswey
lines.transliteration_english: Avagoun Keetay Goun Karai Bhalaa N Avaganu Chiti Vasaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: A noble person does not adopt demerits in his heart and does good to the evil doer.

lines.gurmukhi: guxu kIqy Aauguxu krY burw n mMn AMdir gux pwey
lines.transliteration_english: Gounu Keetay Aougounu Karai Buraa N Mann Andari Goun Paaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: But the evil doer does not adopt virutues in his heart, and does evil to the benevolent.

lines.gurmukhi: jo bIjY soeI Plu Kwey ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Jo Beejai Soee Phalu Khaaay ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: One reaps what one sows.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 Bly bury dI suBwvk nykI bdI

Shabad OS B.translation: Natural evil or goodness of the bad and the noble

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI pQr lIk ijau Blw burw prikriq suBwey
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Padaru Leek Jioun Bhalaa Buraa Parakirati Soubhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: As is the case with water and stone, things are good or bad according to their nature.

lines.gurmukhi: vYru n itkdw Bly iciq hyqu n itkY burY min Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Vair N Tikadaa Bhalay Chiti Haytu N Tikai Burai Mani Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: A noble heart carries no enmity, and love does not abide in an evil heart.

lines.gurmukhi: Blw n hyqu ivswrdw burw n vYru mnhu ivsrwey
lines.transliteration_english: Bhalaa N Haytu Visaaradaa Buraa N Vairu Manahu Visaraaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The noble one never forgets good done to him whereas the evil doer does not forget enmity.

lines.gurmukhi: Aws n pujY duhw dI durmiq gurmiq AMiq lKwey
lines.transliteration_english: Aas N Pujai Duhaan Dee Duramati Guramati Anti Lakhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Both fmd in the end their desires unfulfilled because the evil still wants to commit evil and the noble wants to go on spreading benevolence.

lines.gurmukhi: BilAhu burw n hovhI buirAhu Blw n Blw mnwey
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaliahu Buraa N Hovaee Buriahoun Bhalaa N Bhalaa Manaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The noble cannot commit evil but the noble should not expect nobility in an evil person.

lines.gurmukhi: ivrqIhwxu vKwixAw seI isAwxI isK suxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Virateehaanu Vakhaaniaa Saee Siaanee Sikh Sounaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: This is the essence of the wisdom of hundreds of people and accordingly I have explained the thoughts in vogue around.

lines.gurmukhi: praupkwr ivkwr kmwey ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Paraoupakaar Vikaaru Kamaaay ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Benevolence may (at times) be repaid in the form of evil.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 Bly bury dI khwxI

Shabad OS B.translation: The tale of the noble and bad one)

lines.gurmukhi: ivrqIhwxu vKwixAw Bly bury dI suxI khwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Virateehaanu Vakhaaniaa Bhalay Buray Dee Sounee Kahaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: On the basis of the stories listened to, I have described the present state of affairs.

lines.gurmukhi: Blw burw duie cly rwih aus QY qosw aus QY pwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhalaa Buraa Dui Chalay Raahi Ous Dai Tosaa Ous Dai Paanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: A bad and a noble man went on a journey. The noble one had bread and the evil had water with him.

lines.gurmukhi: qosw AgY riKAw Bly BlweI AMdir AwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Tosaa Agai Rakhiaa Bhalay Bhalaaee Andari Aanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Being noble-natured, the good person laid out bread to eat.

lines.gurmukhi: burw burweI kir gieAw hQIN kiF n idqo pwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Buraa Buraaee Kari Gaiaa Hadeen Kaddhi N Dito Paanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The evil minded performed his wickedness (and ate up his bread) tut did not offer water to him.

lines.gurmukhi: Blw BlweIAhu isiJAw bury burweIAhuM vYix ivhwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Bhalaa Bhalaaeeahu Sijhiaa Buray Buraaeeahoun Vaini Vihaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The noble got the fruit of his nobility (and got liberated) but the evil person had to spend this night of life, weeping and wailing.

lines.gurmukhi: scw swihbu inAwau scu jIAwN dw jwxoeI jwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Sachaa Saahibu Niaau Sachu Jeeaan Daa Jaanoee Jaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: That omnicient Lord is true and His justice is also true.

lines.gurmukhi: kudriq kwdr no kurbwxI ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Kudarati Kaadar No Kurabaanee ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: I am sacrifice unto the creator and His creation (because different are the natutes of the two children of the same Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: 18 rwm Aqy rwvx

Shabad OS B.translation: Ram and Ravan

lines.gurmukhi: Blw burw sYswr ivic jo AwieAw iqsu srpr mrxw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhalaa Buraa Saisaar Vichi Jo Aaiaa Tisu Sarapar Maranaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The evil and noble exist in this world and whosoever came here, has to die one day.

lines.gurmukhi: rwvx qY rwmcMd vwNig mhwN blI liV kwrxu krxw
lines.transliteration_english: Raavan Tai Raamachand Vaangi Mahaan Balee Larhi Kaaranu Karanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The brave persons like Ravan and Ram also became the cause and doers of wars.

lines.gurmukhi: jru jrvwxw vis kir AMiq ADrm rwvix mn Drxw
lines.transliteration_english: Jaru Jaravaanaa Vasi Kari Anti Adharam Raavani Man Dharanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Controlling the mighty age, i.e. conquering the time, Ravan adopted evil in his heart (and stole Sita).

lines.gurmukhi: rwmcMdu inrmlu purKu Drmhu swier pQr qrxw
lines.transliteration_english: Raamachandu Niramalu Purakhu Dharamahu Saair Padar Taranaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ram was a spotless person and due to his sense of dharma (responsibility), even the stones floated in ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: buirAweIAhu rwvxu gieAw kwlk itkw pr qiRA hrxw
lines.transliteration_english: Buriaaeeahu Raavanu Gaiaa Kaalaa Tikaa Par Tria Haranaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: On account of wickedness Ravan went away (was killed) with the stigma of stealing another's wife.

lines.gurmukhi: rwmwiexu juig juig Atlu sy auDry jo Awey srxw
lines.transliteration_english: Raamaainu Jougi Jougi Atalu Say Udharay Jo Aaay Saranaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ramayan (the story of Ram) is ever firm (in the mind of people) and whosoever seeks shelter (in it) goes across (the world ocean).

lines.gurmukhi: js Apjs ivic infr frxw ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Jas Apajas Vichi Nidar Daranaa ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: Dharma-abiding people earn glory in the world and those who undertake evil adventures get infamy.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 rwvx dI jgq pRis`D kQw

Shabad OS B.translation: Famous tale of Ram and Ravan

lines.gurmukhi: soien lMkw vfw gVu Kwr smuMd ijvyhI KweI
lines.transliteration_english: Soin Lakaa Vadaa Garhu Khaar Samound Jivayhee Khaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Golden Lanka was a grand fort and the ocean around it was like a vast moat.

lines.gurmukhi: lK puqu poqy svw lKu kuMBkrxu mihrwvxu BweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Poutu Potay Savaa Lakhu Kounbhakaranu Mahiraavanu Bhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ravan had one lac sons, one and a quarter lac grand sons and brothers like Kumbhkaran and Mahiravari.

lines.gurmukhi: pvxu buhwrI dyie iniq ieMdR BrY pwxI vriHAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Pavanu Buhaaree Dayi Niti Indr Bharai Paanee Varhiaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Air would broom his palaces whereas Indr through rains carried water for him.

lines.gurmukhi: bYsMqur rwsoeIAw sUrju cMdu crwg dIpweI
lines.transliteration_english: Baisantur Raasoeeaa Sooraju Chandu Charaag Deepaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fire was his cook and the sun and the moon his lamp burners.

lines.gurmukhi: bhu KUhix cqurMg dl dys n vys n kImiq pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Bahu Khoohani Chaturang Dal Days N Vays N Keemati Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: His huge army of horses, elephants, chariots and infantry comprising many khuhants (akeauhauts, one aksauhani is known as a mixed force of 21870 elephants, 21870 chariots, 65610 horse and 109350 foot soldiers) was such whose power and grandeur cannot be e

lines.gurmukhi: mhwdyv dI syv kir dyv dwnv rhdy srxweI
lines.transliteration_english: Mahaadayv Dee Sayv Kari Dayv Daanav Rahanday Saranaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He (Ravan) had served Mahadev (Siva) and due to this all the gods and demons were under his shelter.

lines.gurmukhi: Apjsu lY durmiq buirAweI ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Apajasu Lai Duramati Buriaaee ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: But evil intellect and actions earned him infamy.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 rwmcMd dI lok pRis`D kQw

Shabad OS B.translation: Famous story of Ramchandr

lines.gurmukhi: rwmcMdu kwrx krx kwrx vis hoAw dyihDwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Raamachandu Kaaran Karan Kaaran Vasi Hoaa Dayhidhaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Due to some reason, Lord, the cause of all the causes assumed the form of Ramchandr.

lines.gurmukhi: mMin mqyeI AwigAw lY vxvwsu vfweI cwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Manni Matayee Aagiaa Lai Vanavaasu Vadaaee Chaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Accepting the orders of his step mother he went in exile and earned greatness.

lines.gurmukhi: prsrwmu dw blu hrY dIn dieAwlu grb prhwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Parasaraamu Daa Balu Harai Deen Daiaalu Garab Parahaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Compassionate for the poor and decimator of the proud ones Ram effaced the power and pride of Pars'u Ram.

lines.gurmukhi: sIqw lKmx syv kir jqI sqI syvw ihqkwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Seetaa Lakhaman Sayv Kari Jatee Satee Sayvaa Hitakaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Serving Warn, Laksaman became yati, the subduer of all passions and Sits also with all the virtues of a sati, remained totally devoted to Ram and served him.

lines.gurmukhi: rwmwiexu vrqwieAw rwm rwju kir siRsit auDwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Raamaainu Varataaiaa Raam Raaju Kari Srisati Udhaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ramayan spread far and wide as the story establishing Ram-Rajy, a virtuous kingdom.

lines.gurmukhi: mrxu muxsw scu hY swDsMgiq imil pYj svwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Maranu Mounasaa Sachu Hai Saadhasangati Mili Paij Savaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ram had liberated the whole world. Death for them is a truth who, having come to the holy congregation, have fulfilled their commitment to life.

lines.gurmukhi: BilAweI siqgur miq swrI ]20]31]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaliaaee Satigur Mati Saaree ?20?31?ikateeha?

Shabad OS B.translation: Benevolence is the perfect teaching of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: qiRgun AqIq cqurQ gun gMimqw kY pMc qq aulMiG prm qq vwsI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Trigoun Ateet Chaturad Goun Ganmitaa Kai , Panch Tat Ulanghi Param Tat Vaasee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: detaching himself from the worldly attractions and the three its of maya, a Guru-conscious person acquires fourth state and discarding all adorations of the body lives in the memory the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: Kt rs iqAwig pRym rs kau pRwpiq Bey pUr suir spq Anhd AiBAwsI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Khat Ras Tiaagi Praym Ras Kau Praapati Bhaay , Poor Suri Sapat Anahad Abhiaasee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He is not enamoured by the tastes of worldly things, and enjoys the bliss of love of the Lord; and celestial music by keeping Him in his mind all the time

lines.gurmukhi: Ast isDwNq Byd nwQn kY nwQ Bey dsm sQl suK swgr iblwsI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Asat Sidhaant Bhayd Naadan Kai Naad Bhaay , Dasam Sadal Soukh Saagar Bilaasee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: he renunciates yog and ways of Naths and surpasses them ;all-spiritually, and reaching the ultimate, enjoys all happiness and peace.

lines.gurmukhi: aunmn mgn ggn huie inJr JrY shj smwiD gur prcy audwsI hY ]31]
lines.transliteration_english: Ounaman Magan Gagan Hui Nijhar Jharai , Sahaj Samaadhi Gur Parachay Udaasee Hai ?31?

Shabad OS B.translation: because of his high spiritual state and residing his conscious awareness in the Dasam Duar, he gets detached from worldly things and remains in a state of bliss. (31)
